repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
fixes #4217 

Commits have the details, but two were typos and one was the wrong sphinx directive or whatever :c:function: -> :c:func:.

comment_data.body:
This I don't quite follow: latex_paper_size seems to have been removed from sphinx in 2017, so it probably makes sense that we don't try to use it.

But it seems like either `PAPER` shouldn't exist as an option, or we should make it work with whatever sphinx does now (which I'm not quite sure of).

It doesn't seem great to leave a configurable option that does nothing any more.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body:
default settings from the original Sphinx template (from when someone first did sphinx-init) are to have PAPER blank. This causes the option `latex_paper_size` to be omitted. To translate some "clever" bash:

```bash
SPHINXOPTS    =
SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
PAPER         = a4
BUILDDIR      = build

# Internal variables.
PAPEROPT_a4     = -D latex_paper_size=a4
PAPEROPT_letter = -D latex_paper_size=letter
ALLSPHINXOPTS   = -d $(BUILDDIR)/doctrees $(PAPEROPT_$(PAPER)) $(SPHINXOPTS) .
```
roughly translates to
```python
SPHINXOPTS = ""
SPHINXBUILD = "sphinx-build"
PAPER = "a4"
BUILDDIR = "build"

PAPEROPT_a4 = "-D latex_paper_size=a4"
PAPEROPT_letter = "-d latex_paper_size=letter"
# breaking out the paperopt bit here for clarity
looked_up_paperopt = globals().get(f"PAPEROPT_{PAPER}", "")

ALLSPHINXOPTS = f"{BUILDDIR}/doctrees {looked_up_paperopt} {SPHINXOPTS} ."
```

if PAPER = a4, it resolves and grabs the contents of the `PAPEROPT_a4`, same for `PAPEROPT_letter`, invalid ends up resolving to a space or something equally ignored. When `PAPER = nothing ` we find nothing and leave this out. 

Basically leaving PAPER blank makes it ignore this invalid option unless someone overrides it in their command or configs. 

edits: Typos and logic errors
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body: To be clear, if you would like to replace and regenerate the file instead, I am happy to chase whatever (reasonable) direction you desire.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body:
As for a pragmatic answer:

I really doubt anyone is doing Latex renderings of the documentation, which is what this option specifically is for, and if they are, it shouldn't be getting fed in when we are doing HTML anyway. From looking at docs between sphinx and cython, I think this was an accidental add that was missed, or used to have no effect until it was removed as an option.  a
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body:
I think we should either
* replace and regenerate the file,
* remove the `PAPER` option and the `PAPEROPT_` variables that try to use it (because it no longer works at all)

I'm happy with either. The second one is probably easier.

I just don't think we should leave an empty option which no longer does anything.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body: I also think "replace and regenerate" is only worthwhile if it's quick and easy. If it doesn't just work then don't waste much time on it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body:
>  "replace and regenerate" is only worthwhile if it's quick and easy. If it doesn't just work then don't waste much time on it.

Very reasonable. I will proceed with this path. 


Some commands (dirhtml, singlehtml, pickle, json, qthelp) were added by someone to the Makefile in 2012 (https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/1d37db8ac99efb212bf04e4d7d7f38e9e9081e27) same commit as the `a4` setting for PAPER. May I ignore their presence? They may actually just be standard in newer versions of the file.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body: My apologies, looks like I just learned how to submit my comments on a PR in github. Sorry if those came in all at once!!
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body:
> Some commands (dirhtml, singlehtml, pickle, json, qthelp) were added by someone to the Makefile in 2012 (https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/1d37db8ac99efb212bf04e4d7d7f38e9e9081e27) same commit as the a4 setting for PAPER. May I ignore their presence? They may actually just be standard in newer versions of the file.

To me that like it was just regenerating the sphinx config rather than doing anything custom. So it probably isn't worth doing anything special to preserve them.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

comment_data.body: No disagreements here, I will proceed with attempting to replace the Makefile and make.bat. If that gets too complicated, I will nuke the option instead and leave the rest untouched.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 # You can set these variables from the command line.
 SPHINXOPTS    =
 SPHINXBUILD   = sphinx-build
-PAPER         = a4

commit.message:
Removing the `a4` default for PAPER. At present, it is triggering a warning message when building the documentation (make html).

     WARNING: unknown config value 'latex_paper_size' in override, ignoring

 The warning is due to a `latex_paper_size` being configured with an option `-D latex_paper_size=a4`. In a stock Sphinx autogenerated Makefile, this is unset.

When configured to `a4`, the ALLSPHINXOPTS line resolves `$(PAPEROPT_$(PAPER))` -> $(PAPEROPT_a4) -> `-D latex_paper_size=a4`, looking up line 11.

When unconfigured, the lookup fails and we don't specify the option. If we were actually using/expecting this option, there would be a root level variable named `latex_paper_size` in https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/037276bdec686fbe4f385d885ab2ab31adb59a22/docs/conf.py

:c:function: (https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/domains/c.html#directive-c-function) is not what is desired here. :c:func: (https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/domains/c.html#role-c-func) is what we want.
Remove extra `*` the `:c:type:` text role didn't like.
